title: Training DQNs

definitions.Q-table: A table used in reinforcement learning to store the Q-values for each state-action pair.
definitions.Neural network: A computational model designed to simulate the behavior of a human brain, consisting of layers of interconnected nodes or neurons.

formulas: Q(st, at) <- Q(st, at) + α [ rt+1 + η max Q(st+1, a) - Q(st, at) ]
summary: The slide discusses the simplification of the Q-learning algorithm by replacing the Q-table with a neural network. It includes a formula for updating the Q-value and a color-coded diagram explaining the components of the formula.
